title: Does 邦楽 refer to traditional Japanese music or J-pop? - Quora

response.answer_text: 邦楽 Refers to all music made in Japan, but is commonly used just for traditional music. But it can be indeed used to refer to Jpop or Jrock   Domestic meaning any local Japanese musical creation. 洋楽 Yougaku , Would be the opposite term, Referring to Typical Western music.

Tbh I'm not sure this is the first time I saw that Kanji : Hogaku. Japanese Music. So I'm not to sure if it means J-Pop J-Rock or just regular traditional Japanese music. Sorry I could not be of much help, but this was a first for me, and I'v been listening to Japanese music for years lol.
Traditional Japanese music. 邦 (ho) means Japanese and 楽means music in this case. 楽 essentially means “enjoyable.”
